law.text: The notice and claim shall be given to the employer, or if the employer is a partnership, then to any one (1) of the general partners. If the employer is a corporation or a limited liability company, the notice or claim may be given to any agent of the corporation or limited liability company upon whom process may be served, or to any officer of the corporation or any member or manager, as the case may be, of the limited liability company authorized to manage the limited liability company under its articles of incorporation or to any agent of the corporation or limited liability company in charge of the business at the place where the injury occurred. Notice or claim may be given by delivery to any such person or as provided in KRS 342.135.
law.history: Amended 1998 Ky. Acts ch. 341, sec. 46, effective July 15, 1998. -- Codified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 4916.
